title: Typing /me before your message in lobby chat is allowing people to manipulate the client.
body:
Typing /me before a message in a pregame lobby allows the following message to be sent in the text style of the clients system messages.

This is allowing people to trick and confuse others that the system has chosen them for their desired role and causing chaos in games.

pls fix ty.

replies.body:
oh please, let a bit of people have fun.
this is nothing compared to the time that you could send people messages in different colours telling them they were permanently banned.
most people with a brain realise by now its just a fun trick and dont take it seriously

That's cool that you know that, doesn't change the fact that there are others that don't.

I'm trying to get an obvious bug to the attention of riot so they can keep the trolls away from any tools they can get.

Just to clarify, Riot is aware of it and [BroPoro](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/864x9o7b-chat-command-in-lobby?comment=0000) (one of the NA Rioters) stated that it seems to be something that was simply left over in the code and that there's no garentee that it will remain, so it certainly doesn't seem like a bug.

That said, it would be nice if Riot actually made a public statement about it to inform everyone of what it is so people don't get confused and think it's the system assigning people roles.

Thing is, it's not something to get worked up about. If you see someone using it to trick people it's really not that hard to prove that it's just a neat little trick. You can even just use it each time you join a champion select lobby to show people how it works and that it is just a fancy way of using the chat.
I've seen this in chatrooms. Is it that gold italic type font?
i just used to to makes some kids go did anyone just see that how and i was like /me thinks he might tell his team if they win the game 20 minustes later i told them :D:D{{champion:74}}
